title: Historical newspaper corpora for the Deutsches Textarchiv. Ways of their curation, harmonization, and provision to the community

author: Susanne Haaf, Berlin-Brandenburg Academy of Sciences and Humanities

segmentation: Yeah.
Thank you very much for inviting us.

Efforts to get historical newspaper corpora for the Dodgers text.
I have project which we work at.

As I said, it's.

Cards, Dodgers, text, ice, even English German text Archive and our goal is to create a corpus of historical German texts dating back to the 17th to 19th century to enable the studies about the development of the new High German language and.
Currently we have gathered about 3000 works.
Which were all manually transcribed the DTA call corpus is actually about 2000 works, and then there are a lot of works we gathered through curation.

They were manually transcribed and also annotated using the TI annotation text set and special form, and we developed for that and transcription was well performed in the Double King without working method.
So we try to get really high text quality and I hope we achieve that.

Two then the automatic linguistic annotation steps like tokenization, lemmatization, part of speech tagging, and author graphic normalization, which means we are normalizing the historical spelling variants so that you can research the corpus with the modern spelling and get all the historical forms.
And yeah, you can access the text through our platform.
You can perform quite elaborate corpus queries there using our query language, but it's also possible to download other resources to do your own research.

Academy of Sciences in Berlin is a centerpiece for Claren, and so we're providing all our resources through the claron infrastructure as well.
